reviews.text: Loved the art here, my heart raced seeing my first Annie Leibovitz print. A great experience. It did seem as though the guards were watching my fiance and I like hawks, but that's probably standard procedure.
I love that we have a free art museum. I have been a few times and love it each time, but the art for April is fantastic! It's the best art I've seen here!

Small, compact, has good exhibits. Plan on two hours, maybe three tops. Extremely friendly people. Lighting is a little off, it's hard to see with the reflections off the glass - but that could be a function of my height. Right next to the Children's museum, too!

The Greenville Art Museum always has an excellent assortment of both modern and more traditional art from famous local artists. It's always a pleasure and a surprise every time we visit what we will experience next.

This museum consistently has excellent art on display and often has excellent exhibits. The museum displays a lot of artwork by Jasper Johns and Andrew & Jamie Wyeth, and currently has a temporary exhibit of Renaissance-era art (on loan from Bob Jones University). The museum building is great architecturally and worth seeing.

I enjoyed walking around this park. Definitely bring your camera when you come to the falls. You will want to take a couple of good shots. If you plan it right, you can catch a fantastic sunset at the Falls. You can usually find good and free parking at the Governor's school parking lot or around the roundabout. Happy travels!

GORGEOUS. Absolutely unlike any park I have ever been to before. Very clean, well-maintained, no litter even in the water that we saw, plenty of parking (though we did struggle to find it), and some cool events going on today for the STEAM festival. There were people here for prom photos, and my husband and I were here from out of state for the drone races today. Just overall a really great time. Had a small-town, laid-back feel in spite of being pretty crowded today. Really just an excellent time. I'd love to come back!

A beautiful downtown park, popular with locals and tourists alike. Great for strolling, picnics, and people watching. It is close to stores and restaurants. A walking bridge give great views of the Reedy River and its falls. Gorgeous flowers I in the spring.

Nice place to take a walk and delight the eyes. Don't be afraid of security as much as this place is always secure to be here. Enjoy and relax, don't forget the pictures. In summer you can swing a little in the river on your own risk.

What can I say. It's a beautiful place. Even tho its busy it's still brings you a sense of peace and it really can center you. It let's you just take a moment and take in how amazing our natural world is. Spend an hour or so and enjoy it. Well worth several visits

Great service and environment, went there on Thursday which is apparently jazz night. They had an awesome live jazz band playing that night. Wide variety of drinks to choose from with two bars, one upstairs and one downstairs. Four pool tables upstairs to keep you busy, 10 cent for every minute you play which is not bad at all. Highly recommend visiting.

Good food and great beer. Amazing pizza and garlic knots. Laid back atmosphere. Tables and laid back dining room setting on main floor. Upstairs has bar and billards. Friendly and helpful servers. My only complain was with the hostess. Myself and two others in my party we're the first to arrive out of our party of 8. The hostess refused to seat us until more of our party arrived. I didn't understand her reasoning as the three of us awkwardly stood by the front door as she continued to seat other people. Besides that I had a great experience
Great selection of beer and the food was amazing. The bartenders were very friendly and efficient. Overall great place

Came in to play some pool and enjoy some beers. Ended up trying some of the food. The garlic knots where huge and getting them topped with Mozzarella was fantastic! They had peanut butter cheesecake that was great. Definitely a great hangout!

First time visit, pleasantly surprised. It has an atmosphere of what Ashville was in the good old days. Quaint old bar with very good food, big TV for sports. Pizza looked good but we opted for the Jerk chicken sandwich and a burger. Both very good. Friend I was with had not been there in years..but remembered the jerk chicken and he was not disappointed. Excellent service. Set up to accommodate groups, youth friendly but has beer and sports for dad.

Very cool little coffee shop. Prices were awesome for the quality of their product. Seating is very eclectic and fun. They also have some baked goods available.

I'd be a regular if I lived downtown. I'll be back next time I'm there!

Amazing hot chocolate. Never have I ever had hot chocolate that I completely struggled with taking sips over time. I fortunately was able to and enjoyed every last drop of it. Both my tea and hot chocolate were at the perfect temperature. While the food was alright at best coffee underground definitely made up for it with their dessert 100% will go back.

Cool coffee spot. Employees were friendly and the coffee and cheese cake I had were pretty good. This place has a sort of a bigger city feel. It's a great touch that they've got a comedy stage in the same venue too.
Love the atmosphere and location of Coffee Underground. Very nice place for a date night. We like to stop in after dinner and get milkshakes. Highly recommend you check it out when in Downtown.

Cool little spot that is a coffee joint and comedy club connected. Had a couple cocktails and sweet potato fries which were surprisingly outstanding. The cocktails were also very nice. The thing that sets this place apart is the atmosphere and service which are both great!

Great food and AMAZING gelato!! This is a local family owned restaurant that has been totally remodeled! Their attention to detail is incredible! They make all of the food from scratch! Their all new menu has amazing food for everyone! You will not be disappointed going here!! They have some awesome appetizers, like stuffed mushrooms and fried orzo balls!! And to top it off, you will never have better Gelato!!

This was our 1st visit to the new location. Very excited to see the new atmosphere! We ordered lasagna which was awesome, also ordered gelato which we missed (what seemed like forever!!)
Service was great, food was great!
We will definitely return when we are downtown! Keep up the good work! Soooo glad to have Rosa Luna open again!!!
Their new place on Main Street is spectacular.  Friendly staff, great new bar with a dining area.  The gelato was sublime.  Made in house.
Gelato was great but the person at the register not so much.  Not friendly and seemed frustrated.   Not good for a first time visit.   Otherwise I would have given this place 5 stars

The new space is beautiful. I cannot wait to go when the new patio is open.

Everything here is delicious and the owners and staff are amazing.

Incredible evening with good friends at this restaurant. Our first time and we will return. Lovely intimate atmosphere, great service and help with placing our order and the meal and dessert were exceptional. It is nice to have authentic Italian cuisine (Northern Italian) that is a departure from the many chains and pizza parlors. Highly recommend for a special meal.

Best meal I have had in Greenville. From the moment we walked in to the moment we left, everything was perfect. 4 different dishes. Everyone was happy. Antipasto to desert. Definitely will return again and again. If I could give it 6 stars, I would. Service was excellent. There is no other restaurant in Greenville that has come close. The place to go for that special occasion. A little pricey, but so good it does not matter.

This place is a hidden gem in plain sight. every time I go I've noticed the crowd is always older people, usually those in retirement, but my wife and I have been there several times and the food is simply amazing. Every time we're there, they're also making specials that we didn't see any of during previous trips. Each of those that we've ordered have been fantastic as well. Our favorite dish is their appetizer of beef carpaccio. Simply a great place; I've done the last couple of our anniversaries at this establishment because the atmosphere is nice, the food is out of this world, and the price is very respectable for the quality of restaurant. I do not recommend the signature Italian alcoholic beverage, if you ask what it is, I can't remember the name, they will tell you: it's not for beginners.
If you want authentic chef driven Italian food then you must try it. Locally owned and operated

Fabulous. Don't let the Main St location fool you.  This is not a tourist spot.  Food that rivals the best found in large metropolitan cities.  Better than most actually.  Our reaction to the description of the  specials was "I'm not sure I would do that, but I'm going to trust Roxanne" (front of house mgr) followed by "this is an amazing combination of flavors".  We'll be back.

This place is everything it says it is. Delicious southern food accompanied by southern hospitality. I had the short ribs and my fiance had the lamb. Both were delicious. We finished with the white chocolate banana pie. Oh, the cocktails were great also.

Brunch crowds are different from dinner patrons. Brunch is more casual.  Yes, folks show up in almost-PJs. Sigh.
But Soby's deals with this range gracefully.
The food is, as ever, terrific.
Adult beverages are inexpensive -- heck:  cheap. 
The entire brunch is INCREDIBLY AFFORDABLE.  Bring the whole gang.
Fireplaces going on cold days. Efficient buffet lines. Terrific food: southern staples, fun desserts, and wonderful omelet and carving stations. 
Enjoy!
We went New Year's Eve Night.   The service was great.  The waitress was so nice and helpful but the food I ordered was just not prepared well.   The drinks were good.  The bartender was very nice.
Great atmosphere. The waiter was prompt and attentive. Food was chosen by recommendation and we were not disappointed. I would recommend this place for any type of celebration. Will come again.

Food and service was amazing! Wish I could remember my severs name because she was incredible! She was short with a long braided ponytail in the section upstairs. She went over and beyond for us. I will return very soon.

Enjoyed a quiet dinner last night and was more than pleasantly surprised by the fine dining experience we had!  The filet was melt in your mouth delicious and the desert was amazing.  A repeat for us in the future.
Great place.  Good food,  great wine,  wonderful music! Highly suggest checking it out

I've been to Stellar three times now with vastly different experiences.

Please note: I have not tried their food, only been in for wine and drinks.

My first visit was during Artisphere and the place was dead. My husband and I and another couple were there with one bartender who was both entertaining and engaging. We had a few glasses of wine and a shot. A good time was had by all. I was impressed with the bar full of lights, which is a showpiece in itself if you're into that sort of thing. I found it neat.

The second time I stopped in for a midday drink with a realtor friend I was having lunch with, also during an off-peak time, different but equally attentive bartender. A decent time, and no complaints. 

The third time I brought friends from out of town. Same bartender as the first time but now with a second, and at peak-hour (evening) it was hard to get service. The place was busy and it seemed the younger ladies were well cared for while we waited for probably ten minutes past a glass of water to be able to put in an order. We might've stayed longer, but the sense was that there were women and friends at the bar and that we didn't deserve preference. We each had one drink and left with a bit of disappointment. Given the number of bars downtown, I'm inclined to settle in elsewhere where the service is more consistent.

Interesting little wine spot.  Quite expensive, so I don't come here often.  I like the service and the ambiance.  There used to be regular Vitl App offers at this establishment which make the trip worth the cost.

Outstanding food. I am from the low country and this is a must stop on business trips.  Whoever said mediocre wine clearly doesn't have a clue about wine.  Great pairings and extremely knowledgable staff.  Took my young kids and the service was excellent.  Owner comes to our table or gm every visit.

This is a comfortable and well-worn underground restaurant and bar.  It's like putting on your favorite sweater.  It very much feels like walking into an old pub in Europe.

The staff is fantastic and the food is very good.  No teenagers serving food they know nothing about, not a single TV blaring a sporting event (reason enough to stop by), no gimmicky signs or decor, no bright lights or loud music. 

If you love beer, especially Belgian-style brews, with good food, this is the place.

My wife and I love this place.  It's probably our favorite spot in Greenville for a nice dinner.  They have really good food, big portion sizes, and the beer selection is fantastic.  They offer a wide selection of Belgian, Trappist, and Belgian-inspired beers, which the staff (particularly the bartenders) know very well.  

The decor make it feel very European and inviting.  If you get the chance check it our, especially if you like trying beer you can't get everywhere.

They have Duchesse on tap, so if you ever come here, make sure that's your first beer! Food was good. The pasta dish was delicious. Great atmosphere, reminded me of some of the places I've been to in Switzerland. Haven't been to Belgium yet, but seems very authentic.

Trappe Door was unbelievably delicious! The staff was amazing and very attentive. Reservations are strongly suggested, especially for a large party. We ordered the baked brie for an app and white and blue mussels for dinner. You don't go there just to eat a meal. It's a dining experience! Can't wait to go back!

Got take out but a cool underground spot and all the food was delicious! Would probably be best to make reservations on the weekends or even when the weather is nice for their sidewalk seating because it was packed when I went in the early evening on a Saturday.

Mmy husband and I have been to Trio several times before (also many girls nights) and we absolutely love Trio. The food is always impeccable and delicious. 
But tonight we waited over and hour for our entrees with very little updates or check ins by our waiter. We ordered very soon after ordering our drinks. This had to have been close to 7:30. We got our complementary bread, then soon after the feta tomato basil dip that I ordered to go with my cup of soup. I did indicate that I wanted the dip to come out before our entrees, just so we could share and enjoy. Well I didn't expect to wait another hour and watch 5 tables get food before us and leave with their leftovers. Only after we inquired about our food did our waiter go and ask, told us that it would be only a few minutes. Only about 10 more minutes before our food came. It was so piping hot that I could not really eat/ enjoy my soup and we went ahead to get our check so that we wouldn't be waiting much longer. We could see that they were slammed, and the manager was doing all he could, but the fact that our server neglected our table, never alerted his manager that his table had been waiting for nearly and hour for their food, nor attempted to comp any portion or our dinner really left a distaste in our mouths.  
We hope that we will have more positive experiences at Trio again in our future, but will definitely make sure to come in super early to be able to be served in a decent manner.

Wonderful atmosphere, wasn't overly busy where you felt like the server forgot about you. Food was delicious and served promptly. My only criticism was I had the lobster ravioli and for 19 bucks it only came with 7 pieces. For a near 20 dollar dish, I expected a little bit more.  They were decent size about a half dollar for reference, but it was not a filling dish even with their complementary bread. Great place over all and will be back, just might question what dish to actually feed me.

Second time here was disappointing as far as the food.  We loved it here when we came a couple of years ago (all four of us were completely satisfied).  This time, two out of three of us were "just satisfied" and I was not satisfied at all with my meal choices.  First, I tried the seafood pasta (spicy).  I am ok with spicy, but like to be able to taste all the other flavors, too.  All you could taste was this hot spice.  All three of us tried it and said the same.  I sent that back and got the Fettuccini Alfredo thinking can't go wrong with that.  However, this was soupy and had zero taste to it.  Service has been wonderful both times, though.  I think I would try it one more time, but I am not dying to go back.

I absolutely love this place. If I could eat here everyday I would. The Chicken Parmesan is my favorite and it's always so good. That bread, lord that bread was sent from The Lord himself lol I cannot wait to go back.

My margarita pizza was alright but I could definitely tell the tomatoes used on it were not ripe. Though I put some of the extra garlic butter from the bread on it and that really helped. It's alright pizza, but it's not the New York style I love

Please take the misleading information that you have live music particularly Reggae off your Google search. It says you have live music but when I have called, no one knows anything about it. I'm very disappointed because this is false advertising. To prove my point, I copied the information I read. I go out of my way to write good reviews and avoid posting negative ones. But when you claim to have live music- especially live Reggae and you don't, that's false advertising. Please change that in the future to eliminate the frustration that I encountered. 

Here is what I copied. 

Casual quarters for live reggae, jazz, rock & bluegrass along with a Southern-Caribbean menu.

*** Thanks for the response. I suggest you alter your information. When you do so, I will delete my post. I have called several times and no one has any idea that you have ever had live Reggae. I am extremely fair. Once you alter your information, I will gladly delete or modify my post.

What can I say???  This place has the best food, Bloody Mary's, and bartender around.  Hats off to Kate!  Her presence, expertise, and personality made this wayward traveller very happy.  Had a great time! I would recommend this place to everyone!

A bit of a disappointment... Having read the reviews, we were expecting good, uncomplicated food with the risk that service would be slow and inattentive.  We were disappointed on the former, but expectations were met on the latter; the service was bumbling and inefficient.  

The evening started with a hostess who wasn't sure what to do with our reservation, then migrated to an assistant hostess who didn't know what table to take us to.  While we were waiting, the lead hostess told the group after us, a couple out on an apparent date, that they would have to wait 30+ in the bar for their table -- despite there being two-tops that went unused the entire time we were there.  

We waited for almost 30 minutes before a waiter greeted us.  He seemed genuinely apologetic and embarrassed, but then wanted to know exactly who we had dealt with and who had shown us to our table so he "could go talk to them."  That should have been dealt with internally and not involved us.  

The appetizer order was messed up and required a re-firing.  The waiter told us that he was taking it off the bill due to their mistake.  I was surprised to see that they included it on the bill anyway.  An innocent mistake?  Or were they attempting to sneak it past me?  

The dinners were hit and mix.  Some were good.  Others were not.  One chicken dinner featured chicken meat that was so dry it could have passed for jerky.  One street taco dinner was very tasty.

In the land of hit and miss, this was a miss.  It strikes me that this is a good idea, but that management/operations have faltered.  Rather than making sure everyone's experience is a good as can be, the largely millennial staff runs around, trying to put out fires.  And it doesn't need to be that way.  If it were just run more professionally ....

I love their cocktails and food but the last time we visited the service was very slow and it took quite a while for someone to come greet us and take our drink order. Maybe they were just short people that night. Otherwise I normally enjoy my experience eating here and like the tacos.

Really nice, fun staff! Came in here for a couple of beers, and had a great time talking with Sam and Justin! Their wings are really good... Nice spicy flavor, with just a hint of vinegar.

If you're looking for someone laid back and fun, you should check this place out.

We had a wonderful time. Very attentive wait staff. Absolutely delicious food. Well prepared and pleasantly presented.  High end from beginning to end. Prices are high but should be for the kind of service, atmosphere,  and food you receive.
Lazy Goat did everything right. The food was fantastic, app, main course, and dessert were amazing. I had a great glass of wine as well. They also had phenomenal service, our waitress was amazing.

Love lazy goat!! I really enjoy going for drinks and appetizers. They have great cocktails and wines and a fantastic selection of appetizers. The fried goat cheese is incredible, drizzled with honey and topped with pistachios. You get the crunchiness from the fried cheese and the tang from the goat cheese and then the sweetness from the honey and it’s such a great combination. The Brussels sprouts are also amazing! They are crispy and have crispy ham on top and a sherry glaze and manchego cheese. The combination of the flavors is absolutely amazing.

We really really wanted to love it. Our apps (goat cheese balls and the crispy brussel sprouts) were delicious. Great wine pairings. But I had to send my entree back twice. First time it wasn't cooked. Second time (completely different order) tasted like lemon thyme (nice!) and dish soap (not nice). Wait staff was totally nice about it. Manager was very apologetic. We'll give it another try soon. The atmosphere is lovely and the view is beautiful.

Good food and a great location! I personally have difficulty with the very complicated flavors they serve, so I can only go once a month or so. I strongly recommend going for lunch as the dinner can get pricey.
Veggie calzone was delicious and gigantic. Went on Tuesday for half off tall boy domestics and they had a great selection. Staff was friendly and attentive.
Great atmosphere with great service. You can't go wrong with this place. We ordered our food and we got it quick! Great selection of beers too!

We came from Georgia where I first encountered this chain. Over there the pizza was amazing. Simply to die for. And when we moved here I was so excited to see that there was a location near us. We drove from Lafayette to dine here because we loved the locations in Georgia so much. I was so disappointed. More like heartbroken. Our buffalo pizza stopped being made halfway up the pizza leaving a thick piece of crust. Our bbq chicken side was burnt. We asked for no onions on both sides there were onions. The crust was not like the other locations. It was hard. My son got the pretzel bites the only good thing that came to our table. It's what I expected my crust on my pizza to be. Our waitress forgot about us once it got busy. The host was the only reason this place got 2 stars. She was amazing and so friendly with my son. I think it needs to meet the management at other locations. Next time we will wait till I visit my in laws in Georgia. Such a huge let down. And dont tell me about it being burnt because it goes into an oven when 2 completely different locations have the same crust and same quality of food on the opposite sides of Georgia. There's something not right with this location.
A very clean  restaurant. Friendly staff not afraid to smile an say hello. Good food. Overall a pleasant experience
Great Pizza! Good servers with efficient service and decent serving time. Try the House special and the mighty meaty! The spinach dip is great too.

The food here is absolutely delicious! I ordered the Rack of Lamb and it was fantastic, the meat was beyond tender and the flavor was incredible, some of the best Persian food I've ever had. The aesthetic and hospitality is very nice as well.

The food is always top notch.  Beautiful environment with a down to earth wait staff.  Always love the Rice with cranberries I think it's the best rice ever made.  The meat was super tender and flavorful and so was the chicken. Every chance I get to go I will never say no to this place.  Very very lovely.
Second time here and again lived what I had.  Lamb Shank delicious, chicken and tenderloin kebabs delicious!!!  Beautiful outdoor area with a quirky tribute to the Art de Ponce bridge in Paris

Drinks were great... especially the Pomegranate martini.  Hummus was excellent, we had pico and red pepper.  Good atmosphere, nice service.  Meals were slightly over priced in my opinion but good portions.  The rice was fluffy and cooked well.  I had lamb which had a good flavor but lacked seasoning.  Overall a nice experience.

Unique and delicious food. Simple and tasty. Nothing like it in Greenville that I've found. I've done lunch, dinner, and business events here. Nothing stumps the staff and I've never experienced a lag or drop off in food or service quality. If you haven't tried it yet, stop depriving yourself.

When you want a delicious fresh made to order burger this is the place to go.  Great burgers ,fresh buns , and many delicious  toppings.  Food is  consistantly good and service is fast and friendly. I like when you order fries they don't skimp on the amount and always throw  extra into the bag.  Fries are cut fresh and delicious.  Clean restaurant with nice seating.  Free peanuts to munch on while you wait.  Food is delicious .  Love it.

This Five Guys was amazing. I was able to order online so I only waited a few minutes.  They gave me a free soft drink while I waited.  I received an amazing burger, plenty of perfect very hot fries.  Clean, quick and awesome service.

Always a good experience. Staff is pleasant (and they were even singing along to the music, which was fun) and the restaurant is always clean. Coke machine was out of quite a few flavor cartridges, but this was the first time that happened.

The food is good but I always thought it is expensive for what you get. 
We got 2 small cokes, small French fries, 1 bacon cheese burger (double patty) and 1 cheese burger (single) .... All for the bargain price of $27.30! Plus a wonderfully cozy atmosphere.
This place was always so clean & staff was so friendly. Anyone else notice the un-cleanliness or the attitudes between the pm manger & staff :(  we will not be returning!

I’ve been coming to Pita house for 8 years now. Reminds me of back home. Definitely the best middle eastern food you can buy in the area. It’s family owned, and they’re very nice and customer oriented. The food is phenomenal. Definitely recommend.

We have been here three times now and every time we leave very happy. The food here is fresh and delicious. Every dish has good flavor and is authentic. The staff is very friendly and the store part has a lot to offer. Definitely a must for Middle Eastern cuisine. Great place!

Pita House on South Pleasantburg Road is the best place to experience Middle Eastern food!! The way the chefs cook the food will have you begging for more! Absolutely delicious is the best way I can describe the food here... everything is perfectly spiced and cooked to perfection! I should know, I've been eating here for the past 14 years!! 
They even have a grocery store off to the side the restaurant for those of us who are brave enough to try making our own food at home! There's everything to love about the Pita House!! I've never been disappointed with the service, food or, experience here!!

Been going here for over 15 yrs. Clean, fast, family friendly. Amazing food. Best hummus and tahini salad I've ever had. Whenever I'm in my home town I plan my trips to be able to go by to eat here. Love Love this place!
This place has a family diner feel to it. The food is outstanding. great place. bring cash or check. they don't accept debit cards
